<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Giant Hunter](/Feats.aspx?ID=3900) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Kingmaker</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Ranger" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=136" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Kingmaker Companion Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=151) pg. 23</row>

</column>

---

You have studied [giants](/Traits.aspx?ID=79) and hunt them with efficiency. When you roll initiative and can see a giant, you can [Hunt Prey](/Actions.aspx?ID=10) as a free action, designating that enemy as your prey. 

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the giant yet with [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26). The benefit doesn't apply against giants disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a giant.

<title level="2">Giant Hunter leads to...</title>
[Giant Slayer](/Feats.aspx?ID=3904), [Roll with It (Ranger)](/Feats.aspx?ID=3903)

<title level="2">Adventuring with Ekundayo</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Kingmaker Companion Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=151) pg. 23</row>

Ekundayo eventually develops his own methods to pursue his favored enemies—giants. Once he gains the Magical Crafting feat at 4th level, he begins to craft specialized ammunition and runes for weapons. As long as his attitude toward the PCs is at least friendly, he shares these discoveries with them, unlocking the following ranger class feats and items as soon as his level equals the level of the feat or item.

**Related Feats**: [Giant Slayer](/Feats.aspx?ID=3904), [Hamstringing Strike](/Feats.aspx?ID=3902), [Roll with It (Ranger)](/Feats.aspx?ID=3903), [The Harder They Fall (Ranger)](/Feats.aspx?ID=3901)
